text: Valentyna Ksenofontivna Rastvorova (; 17 July 1933 - 24 August 2018) was a Ukrainian fencer. Rastvorova was in the 1956 Summer Olympics, 1960 Summer Olympics, and the 1964 Summer Olympics. She won two silver medals and one gold medal. ==Personal life== She was born in Odesa, Ukraine. Her daughter, Yelena Grishina, was in the Olympics. Her grandson, Sergey Bida, is an épée fencer. He won a silver medal in Tokyo. He is also an épée champion. He moved to the United States in 2023. ==Career== Rastvorova was in three Olympic Games in the individual foil and team foil events. She won an individual silver medal and team gold medal in 1960, and a team silver medal in 1964. At the 1956 Olympics, she came in fifth place. After retiring, she was a coach at her club, Dynamo Moscow. ==Death== Rastvorova died on 17 July 1933, at the age of 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1933 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Ukrainian sportspeople Category:Fencers Category:Olympians for the Soviet Union Category:Medalists at the 1960 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Odesa
title: Valentina Rastvorova
